duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage a major component of a multi-disciplinary infrastructure program with technical and non-technical complexity, under the direction of the Program Manager.
Promote alignment within the integrated consultant and client Program and project component teams through effective and regular communications.
Develop and implement various plans, business processes, and tools to drive efficiency, emphasize accountability, bring team alignment, and promote transparency.
Monitor and manage internal and external factors related to the assigned project component that influence the Program.
Coordinate with project controls team and multiple project delivery teams to monitor and control the program/project’s scope, cost, schedule, and quality metrics.
Manage component risk register and enforces Program Risk Management policies and procedures.
Develop component scope, budget, and schedule for tasks under the Program Management contract.
Monitors status of component performance and deliverables and develops monthly reports for the client.
Assist in securing resources required to deliver services specified in the contract scope with a focus on contract compliance.
Coordinates client’s interdisciplinary review of project deliverables.
Prepare and make detailed presentations to the team and client.
Organize component assignments to develop junior staff.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in an Engineering discipline, Construction Management, or closely related field. U.S. P.E. or Canada P.Eng. or the ability to obtain through reciprocity in 6 months is required.
Minimum fifteen (15) years of experience in the management and delivery of civil engineering infrastructure projects and/or large water or wastewater development projects.
Current holder of, or have no restrictions to obtain, sufficient immigration documents for travel to/from U.S. and Canada.
Valid driver's license required and a clean driving record.
PMP or PgMP certification through the Project Management Institute.
